meanings.definition: Having a tendency to dip or sink
meanings.sent1: The boat was the dippiest of all, always leaning to one side.
meanings.sent2: The wet sponge was the dippiest, easily absorbing all the water.
meanings.sent3: The dippiest umbrella kept turning inside out in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was like the dippiest balloon, ready to burst at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The dippiest sandcastle couldn't withstand the incoming tide.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of intelligence or common sense
meanings.sent1: He made the dippiest decision by wearing shorts in the snow.
meanings.sent2: The dippiest student in class always forgot to bring a pencil.
meanings.sent3: It was the dippiest idea to try and fit a square peg into a round hole.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation was the dippiest, leaving everyone confused.
meanings.sent5: The dippiest squirrel kept trying to bury its acorn in the snow.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a silly or eccentric behavior
meanings.sent1: The dippiest clown at the circus had everyone laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: Her dippiest dance moves always stole the show at parties.
meanings.sent3: The dippiest cat would chase its own tail for hours.
meanings.sent4: His dippiest hat collection was the talk of the town.
meanings.sent5: The dippiest costume at the party was a giant banana suit.
